definition: brimming with confidence (idiom)
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
hundred/numerous/all kinds of
surname Bai
(two, three etc) -fold/times (multiplier)/double/to increase or multiply

sentences.english: I will greet the new sun with confidence.
sentences.chinese: 我將信心百倍，迎接新的太陽。

sentences.english: Molly looked at confidence one hundred times MiaoQing, heart also rises with concern.
sentences.chinese: 莫莉看着信心百倍的苗青，心中也升起陣陣擔憂。

sentences.english: In viewing the future, LingYi People are full of confidence.
sentences.chinese: 展望未來，林一人信心百倍。

sentences.english: Full of confidence and zealousness, I want to do some foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 我信心百倍，滿腔熱忱要把外貿做出來。

sentences.english: Autumn is a season of harvest in the future, we are full of confidence.
sentences.chinese: 秋天是一個收穫的季節，展望未來，我們信心百倍。

sentences.english: Full of confidence and zealousness , I want to do some foreign trade.
sentences.chinese: 我信心百倍，滿腔熱忱要把外貿做出來。

definition: having high fighting spirit
enormously proud of one's success (idiom); smug/complacent
enthusiasm for doing sth
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
full of vigor (idiom)/lively/in high spirits
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
grinning from ear to ear (idiom)/beaming with happiness
to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
to gather one's spirits/to pull oneself together
lit. to win a victory on raising the flag (idiom); fig. to start on sth and have immediate success/success in a single move
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
